result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Staci D. Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Staci D.
defendant.address: 534 W Grand Ave., Apt 2, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt:
(9:00 AM case called.) Defendant Staci D. Johnson in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Staci D. Johnson. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
State moves to amend Count 7 to a Misdemeanor charge of Neglect of a Child.
Court orders Count 7 is amended to a Misdemeanor charge of Neglect of a Child.
Defendant pleads Guilty of Amended Count 7: Neglect of a Child.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty plea and withholds finding of Guilt.

Court places the defendant on a Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement (DAGP) for 2 years with conditions to include community service. If the defendant is successful on the DAGP at the end of 2 years the charge will be dismissed.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:04 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Staci D. Johnson in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video via Zoom for Staci D. Johnson. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Attorney Rivard states there is a possible DAGP and asks for return date to allow time to discuss offer with the Defendant.

Status Conference set for 10/20/2022 9:00 AM (1/2 hour in person)
Order approving request to appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 08/23/2022 at 11 a.m.
